wikipedia_page.main: George Arthur Clinton (1850–1913) was a British clarinettist. He was a member of Queen Victoria's private ensemble beginning at age 17. He was the principal clarinettist for the Philharmonic Society and The Crystal Palace, and taught at several universities.His family included several notable clarinettists. His father Arthur was a bandleader and clarinettist. His brother James created a "combination" clarinet.

response: *George Clinton (Royal Navy officer) (1686–1761), British colonial governor of Newfoundland and of New York
*George Clinton (vice president) (1739–1812), Vice President of the U.S. and Governor of New York
*George Clinton Jr. (1771–1809), U.S. Representative from New York, nephew of Vice President George Clinton
*George Clinton (born 1846), member of the 107th New York State Legislature (1884), son of Mayor George W. Clinton
*George Clinton (rugby league) (1924–2010), English rugby league footballer who played in the 1940s and 1950s, and coached in the 1950s and 1960s
*George Clinton Sweeney (1895–1966), United States federal judge
